page.title: 06Shopping In Fulwood.
page.content: Before the new shopping centre was built people in Fulwood used to shop at Booth's and other shops on Garstang Road because these were the only shops in the area of Fulwood. As more houses were built around St. Peter's school it was decided to build a new shopping centre so that it was nearer and people did not have to go as far to shop. In 1978 the first shop to be built and opened was Booth's which is a big supermarket whose roof is shaped like a Swiss chalet. Other shops were built around it including N.S.S. a newsagent, a children's shop, a clothes shop, a curtain shop and an optician. Two car-parks were built and a "bottle-bank" is there together with a pillar-box and a telephone box. Many people from the immediate area and outside use the facilities of the centre with its seats and coffee shop.
